Package seng202.group5.logic

Class Finance

  • java.lang.Object
    • seng202.group5.logic.Finance
  • public class Finance
extends java.lang.Object
    Finance class records order history, refunds past orders and calculates change.

    • Method Detail

      • refund

        public java.util.ArrayList<org.joda.money.Money> refund​(java.lang.String ID)
        Refunds a previous order and returns the list of notes to return in descending size order.
        Parameters:
        ID - the id of the order to refund
        Returns:
        a list of Money representing coins in descending size order

      • pay

        public java.util.ArrayList<org.joda.money.Money> pay​(java.util.ArrayList<org.joda.money.Money> amountPayed,
                                                     java.time.LocalDateTime datetime,
                                                     Order order)
                                              throws InsufficientCashException
        Saves order to database and returns a list of notes to return as change.
        Parameters:
        amountPayed - a list of Money representing the coins payed
        datetime - the Date and time the order occurred at
        order - the order that is being paid for
        Returns:
        a list of Money representing coins to give as change in descending size order
        Throws:
        InsufficientCashException - Throws error when total cost is negative or the total cost is higher than the amount payed

      • totalCalculator

        public java.util.ArrayList<org.joda.money.Money> totalCalculator​(java.time.LocalDateTime startDate,
                                                                 java.time.LocalDateTime endDate)
        returns a list containing total profits, average profits, and other information to be displayed on the finance screen over the imputed time period Index 0: Total income before expenses Index 1: Average daily income before expenses Index 2: Total profits Index 3: Average daily profits
        Parameters:
        startDate - the first date to search from
        endDate - the last date to search to
        Returns:
        a list of Money representing total profits, average profits, and other things

        Returns:
        returns a list containing the change need to be returned
